title: Manhole fires on Newbury Street prompt building and street evacuations
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Six manhole explosions on Newbury Street in Boston prompted evacuations and street closures on February 3.
Streets closed included Newbury Street between Exeter and Clarendon, per Boston Fire Department and WCVB reports.
No injuries were reported, with evacuations extending from Gloucester Street to Dartmouth Street, affecting four buildings.

title: South Station’s new fare gates still out of service more than a week after snow storm
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: South Station's new fare gates have been out of service since a major snowstorm hit Boston a week ago.
The MBTA spokesperson attributes the shutdown to heavy snow accumulation affecting the gates' operation.
40 fare gates, installed at a cost of $3.3 million, remain out of service as Keolis and Scheidt & Bachmann assess damages.

title: Devin McCourty on ’25 Patriots: ‘A lot different than us’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Devin McCourty praised the current New England Patriots for their mentality and ability to beat any team.
The Patriots, led by Mike Vrabel, have a different approach compared to the Brady-Belichick era, according to McCourty.
McCourty expressed pride in the Patriots' Super Bowl run and enjoys engaging with the team's new generation.

title: Woman who posed as student at Boston high schools accepts plea deal, sentenced to probation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Shelby Hewitt, 34, posed as a student at three Boston high schools using aliases during the 2022-2023 school year.
Hewitt pleaded guilty to forgery, identity fraud, and violating conduct standards, receiving four years of probation and $9,000 restitution.
As part of the plea deal, Hewitt must avoid Boston Public Schools, continue mental health treatment, and is barred from social work employment.

title: BPS pauses new hiring amid deficit as district predicts hundreds of layoffs next year
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Boston Public Schools implements partial hiring freeze due to a projected $53 million budget deficit for this fiscal year.
The closure of three schools by 2027 could lead to 300-400 teacher and paraprofessional job cuts.
Rising health insurance, transportation, and special education costs are major contributors to the budget shortfall.

title: From SNL-style ‘Weekend Updates’ to a TD Garden beer chug, Will Campbell isn’t afraid to bring the laughs
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Will Campbell performs humorous SNL-style 'Weekend Updates' for Patriots' coach Mike Vrabel to lighten Friday meetings.
Campbell entertained Celtics fans with a TD Garden beer chug and shirtless flex during a Celtics-Heat game.
Campbell has been a key addition to the Patriots' offensive line but faced setbacks, including an MCL sprain.

title: Police searching for Dorchester girl missing since Thursday
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: 17-year-old Mela Rosario was last seen near Brockton courthouse after a family court appearance, according to Boston Police.
Mela was reported missing from her Dorchester home around 11 p.m. on January 29, wearing a pink jacket and black leggings.
Authorities urge anyone with information on Mela Rosario's whereabouts to contact Boston Police or District C-11 Detectives at (617) 343-4335.

title: Devin McCourty explains ‘travesty’ following Belichick, Kraft Hall-of-Fame snubs
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick and Robert Kraft were not selected for the Pro Football Hall of Fame Class of 2026.
Devin McCourty expressed confusion over the exclusion, labeling it a 'travesty' given their notable achievements.
Kraft reached the finalist stage in 2026 after multiple semifinal attempts, but will not be inducted this year.

title: Celtics reportedly trade Anfernee Simons to Bulls, acquire Nikola Vučević
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Celtics trade Anfernee Simons and a second-round pick to Chicago Bulls for Nikola Vučević and a pick.
Nikola Vučević averages 16.9 points, 9 rebounds, and 3.8 assists, providing a frontcourt boost for Boston.
The trade reduces Celtics' luxury tax penalty from $39.5 million to $17.7 million, staying under the first tax apron.

title: What Mike Vrabel said of Robert Kraft’s latest snub from Pro Football Hall of Fame
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Robert Kraft was not voted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame Class of 2026.
Kraft has been eligible for the Hall of Fame since 2013, advancing to semifinals for the first time this year.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel supports Kraft's eventual Hall of Fame induction, citing his significant contributions to the team.
